column4: 255 E Basse Rd Ste 940 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: Great for Girls Night Out! We all enjoyed our Road Trips (where you get to sample three different wines). Would be nice to sit outside on a cool fall evening but luckily for San Antonio it raining. Would bring my husband back for a romantic date night! Apps were awesome!

column4: 146 East Houston San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The food was over cooked. Staff seemed to be happy to move you in and out. No personal attention. This was the worst choice for anniversary dinner

column4: 600 E. Market St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Apps were great, service slow, weak margarita, very salty sauce on Peruvian beef stir fry.

column4: 8539 Fredericksburg Rd San Antonio, TX  78229
column13: My husband an I celebrated our 4th anniversary at Aldos. It was perfect an very romantic! Our server was great! He recommended a wine that was delicious! The food was.also perfect we loved it! We will make this a tradition for sure! Thank you Aldos for a beautiful night!

column4: 9800 Hyatt Resort Drive San Antonio, TX  78251
column13: As good as it gets in San Antonio or anywhere else.

column4: 106 River Walk San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Lovely, quaint find! Food was amazing as well as service and atmosphere! Would reccomend to anyone and would deffinately go back!

column4: 203 S. St. Mary's St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Very romantic, exceptional service, fine wine list, and wonderful food - what more could you want.

column4: 926 S Presa Street San Antonio, TX  78210
column13: Lamb loin was perfection with roasted vegetables, including a beautiful Jerusalem artichoke. Salad w/their lemon vinegarette was great and beef tenderloin empanada appetizer's crust and flavors were super together. The chocolate dessert w/caramel corn was a delicious surprise in combination...Service was attentive and upbeat. We will definitely go again, and again.

column4: 219 East Houston Street Suite 275 San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: First time at Bohanan's....Great special occasion restaurant, extensive wine list, outstanding service.Tableside bananas foster, too full this time but will definitely try it when I go back. Tons of food. French onion soup looked divine although that would be my entire meal. Will be back, french onion soup and bananas foster here I come

column4: 16641 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Typical Texas hotel food, except probably pricier since it's a Westin.

column1: Chart House Restaurant - Tower of the Americas
column4: 601 Tower of the Americas Way San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: We went here for our first anniversary. I mentioned this in the reservation and they went out of their way to make it an unforgettae night. They sat us at a big booth with a spectacular view even though it was just two of us. They even printed Happy First Anniversary on the menu for us! Great food, great service, fantastic view, and made me look good by all of the things they did! Definitely would recommend

column4: 150 East Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Everything about Citrus was amazing. The food was creative,flavorful and the presentation was eye pleasing. The service was very good with out being over bearing.This is one of the best meals ever.

column4: 119 Staffel St Boerne, TX  78006
column13: Celebrated a 95th family birthday and it was perfect! The food was delicious, I especially like their soups and salads, but all was good. The setting is charming. A must go restaurant in Boerne!

column4: 18740 Stone Oak Parkway San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: Our waiter was super attentive. It was our first time there for Brunch. We each had eggs benedict.... the eggs were poached perfectly! Looking forward to go there for dinner sometime soon!!! Would definitely recommend it to others!

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - San Antonio
column4: 255 East Basse Road Suite 200 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: Went in for a birthday celebration. The food and service were outstanding!

column4: 16641 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Overall Excellent.We were very pleased.

column4: 14439 NW Military Highway Suite 100 San Antonio, TX  78231
column13: Had my birthday there, they organized us a private 10 seater table that was fantastic as were a bit of a noisy bunch. Food was fantastic

column4: 24116 IH10 W San Antonio, TX  78257
column13: Consistently great food, service and ambiance!

column4: 2360 Gruene Lake Dr New Braunfels, TX  78130
column13: I thought overall the whole dining experience at The Gruene Door was excellent. I got the ribeye, which surpassed expectations. It tasted like it had been cooked over an outdoor wood grill with a nice wood-smoke flavor. It was nice and tender, with very little fat waste. It was topped with a pat of butter, which I could have done without, it really didn't enhance the flavor.My wife got the grilled salmon. She thought it tasted nice, and the sauce on the side was tasty to her.

column1: JW Marriott San Antonio - Cibolo Moon
column4: 23808 Resort Parkway San Antonio, TX  23808
column13: I only had a basic breakfast but everything was good. The coffee tasted fresh and was hot (they leave the hot carafe on your table so you don't have to keep asking); orange juice was fresh-tasting; the yogurt parfait of plain yogurt, granola, honey & fresh berries hit the spot. Service was on the mark, especially with me advising them of having an early spa booking (for those that don't know, this is a resort restaurant).

column4: 123 N. Loop 1604 San Antonio, TX  78232
column13: The food was really well prepared. Our serving Staff were very knowledgeable on the menu and wine options.One critique I would have, it was really too dark, almost to dark to read the menu! Other then that we enjoyed our experience.

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway The Shops At La Cantera San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: It was my son's 30th birthday celebration and we loved it! The food was excellent and we will definately return at some point in the future.

column4: 3500 Island Moorings Pkwy Port Aransas, TX  78373
column13: The best food we've had in Port A. We go to Port A at least twice a year and we were thrilled to discover La Barataria. We will be sure to go here every time we go in the future. I had a sashimi medley of three kinds of fish and it was outstanding. Lobster cake appetizer was wonderful and their pizzas were amazing! Highly recommended!

column4: 2415 N. Main Ave San Antonio, TX  78212
column13: The best brunch in town! Exciting menu, great presentation, great service!

column4: 112 College Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: We eat here pretty often, before catching the show at the Majestic Theater. They always prepare a great meal. The wait staff was great. Courteous and accommodating for some special needs we have. The only criticism was that the kitchen was slow getting the food to the table. Overall a good experience.

column4: 306 West Market Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Food was good, I had the best server Jesica,

column4: 200 N. Seguin Ave. New Braunfels, TX  78130
column13: This was the second time we've eaten there in the last 2 weeks. Food was even better than the first time. The seafood trio appetizer was wonderful. Wish we lived closer. The only thing we wish were different is the noise level, but don't let that deter anyone from eating there.

column4: 3610 Avenue B San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: I loved the relaxing atmosphere of Little Aussie. I will definitely be back to buy freshly prepared gluten-free breads and pie crusts before the holiday rush begins. Great gem of a restaurant right, in our neighborhood too!.

column4: 11255 Huebner Rd San Antonio, TX  78230
column13: Great food and great wine. The wait staff were very attentive and the armosphere is fantastic.

column4: 125 E. Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: I was expecting better. I had the quail and belguim waffles. The quail was barely warm and the waffles were cool and didn't melt any of the butter. The shrimp and crab bisgue soup was very good. The the Texas blueberry crisp was superb.

column4: 17603 Interstate I-10 W San Antonio, TX  78257
column13: Very pleasant experience. Seated exactly at our reservation time.

column4: 340 East Basse Road, Suite 101 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: We have been here multiple times and enjoyed it each time. This time we went for Sunday brunch. Everything was great- food was brought out quickly, excellent taste and presentation ( we had crabs Benedict, hangover hash, egg sandwich) and server was friendly. Only concern was that the communication regarding the "bottomless" mimosas that we asked about. The server responded that that option was the "max'd out mimosas" for $6.75. She went on to say that if you got more than 2 glasses, this was the best option as the regular mimosas were $3.75 per glass. When our bill came, our "max'd out mimosas" for 2 people came to $30. They charged us $6.75/glass, not quite bottomless or "max'd out."

column4: 14855 Blanco Rd,  Suite 110 San Antonio, TX  78216
column13: It was pricey but worth it. The servings are generous and it is a great setting for conversation. You will easily spend $100 for two people so if you're on a budget, this place is probably not for you. I brought my 9 and 10 year old girls with me and they had a ball. Overall it was a good experience and I will be going back.

column4: 300 E. Crockett Street Suite 283 San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Always a great place for a steak! Service was great and even went out of their way to give us a free drink when the wine we ordered wasn't chilled. If you are looking for great food from appetizer to desert then Morton's is your place.

column4: 136 N Castell New Braunfels, TX  78130
column13: Celebrated the 50th wedding anniversary of my parents this weekend. It was fabulous food and service. We are glad we chose Myron's Prime Steak House to celebrate.

column1: Oro at The Emily Morgan Hotel
column4: 705 E Houston Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The portions were small, especially for the expense. Our waiter was HORRIBLE and forgot orders, never refilled drinks, and mixed up orders. He was mostly non exsistent. However another waiter was more than happy to help our table of 6 even though he wasn't being tipped.

column4: 212 W. Crockett St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The best restaurant in the River Walk area. Fresh fish, thoughtfully prepared. Spinach salad with pecans, cheddar and apple is delicious. Good for breakfast, too.

column4: 1401 N Loop 1604 W Suite 105 San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: Third time to dine here. All was very good. Only hitch was that they forgot to give us our leftover salad, but we forgot to check to see if it was in the bag.

column4: 233 East Houston Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: This was a first visit and our anniversary. I was able to notify the restaurant of the occasion through Open Table's web site and the table was set appropriately and ready for our arrival. Food and service was top notch and there's no doubt we'll return.

column4: 5800 Broadway San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: Once again, we had a wonderful experience at Paloma Blanca. On this occasion we were dining with a friend from out of town. Shortly, after we set down we were encountered another acquaintance who joined us for drinks and ultimately appetizers (the Bontana Chica). The waiter was very gracious and attentive as we enjoyed our appetizers and cocktails. Ultimately, we ordered dinner with each of us ordering a different enchilada dinner. Mine were the Enchiladas Diviorciadas which have both the Salsa Verde and Ranchera and it was wonderful. Throughout the evening our waiter was engaging and attentive allowing us to enjoy our visit and ensuring a wonderful overall experience.

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway Suite 22200 San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: We were all impressed with the delicious food, attentive service and comfortable atmosphere at Perry's. Order the pork chop...it is extraordinary!

column1: Q on the Riverwalk - Hyatt Regency
column4: 123 Losoya St San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: FOOD WAS EXCELLENT AND SERVICE WAS OUTSTANDING

column4: 152 E. Pecan, #100 San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: This was a wonderful dining experience. The food was fabulous and the service was attentive.

column4: 1806 NW Loop 1604 San Antonio, TX  78248
column13: Food was mediocre. Pork Carnitas just ok. Friend of the prime rib, was just ok. Black beans were the best thing on my plate.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Antonio (Airport)
column4: 7720 Jones Maltsberger Concord Plaza San Antonio, TX  78216
column13: There are multiple other places I'd rather go, for the money. Food was good, not great. Same with the service and ambiance. I honestly just expect more from a fine dining establishment.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Antonio (Downtown)
column4: 1170 E. Commerce Street Sunset Station St. Paul Square San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The downtown version of this restaurant far exceeds its sister location in Alamo Heights. The decor, the service and the food are above par.

column4: 4035 N Loop 1604 W, Ste 102 San Antonio, TX  78257
column13: Food and service always good. Scuzzi's is great about special requests, too.

column4: 434 N.Loop 1604 West San Antonio, TX  78232
column13: We have been going to Silo for a long time. Typically I would say once a month we are there for some reason, some occasion. We love the food and the happy hour in the bar is fantastic. This trip, and one other one, we had the same waiter Travis. The first time we had Travis, we were with a large group. He is not a child friendly waiter. I am not talking about toddlers either. We had 10yr olds and older with us on both occasions. Specifically this time, my Son who is 11, and has eaten with us at everytime we have been to Silo. When asking what the specials were, the waiter began telling my husband and I and said, he (meaning my son) probably thinks this is a bunch of jibberish. Actually, no, my son was the one who ordered the special.

column4: 1133 Austin Hwy San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: What a pleasant surprise. Food was great. Service was excellent. Looking forward to our next visit.

column4: 999 East Basse,Suite 130 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: The only problem I had was that it was too loud!! We were screaming across the table to have a conversation.

column4: 203 South Saint Mary's San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Staff knowledgeable about various sakes. Tried an unfiltered one that I would not have tried if the waitress didn't suggest and explain what it was.Presentation of the rolls was excellent. Combinations were tasty and not run-of-the-mill. Found the restaurant by accident, but would go back if I were to visit San Antonio again.

column4: 401 S. Alamo San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Beautiful dishes and the homemade pastas were terrific.

column4: 1834 NW Loop 1604 San Antonio, TX  78248
column13: Great dinner but incredibly noisy.

column4: 207 North Presa Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Everything was great from start to finish. The prickly pear margaritas are amazing. The food was to die for, it really was that good. We had the souffle for desert, even more amazing. Our waitress was super nice and attentive. I will be coming back a few more times!

column4: 420 W. Market Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Pizzeta appetizer and house salads were delicious. The farfalle pasta was a little overcooked (pasta was too soft), but the rigatoni with lamb meatballs was excellent. The bread pudding was a great dessert.

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway Ste 25100 San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Everything was so wonderful, every aspect of the night...Makes eating out such a pleasue
